private_information: Authority to move disks: A, B, C, D, E
Knows Tower of Hanoi rules and must respect agent partitioning
Prefers minimal interference with disks F–O
agent_1.goal: Propose a feasible sequence of primitive moves using only disks A–E to achieve the specified goal configuration while respecting Tower of Hanoi rules.

private_information: Authority to move disks: F, G, H, I, J
Knows Tower of Hanoi rules and must respect agent partitioning
Default stance: avoid moving F–J unless strictly necessary
agent_2.goal: Safeguard medium disks (F–J) and provide constraints or confirmations to ensure they remain undisturbed unless absolutely required.

private_information: Authority to move disks: K, L, M, N, O
Knows Tower of Hanoi rules and must respect agent partitioning
Default stance: keep large disks (K–O) fixed on the left peg
agent_3.goal: Ensure large disks (K–O) remain stationary on the left peg throughout the plan.

private_information: Role: audit temporal and causal consistency
Removes bookkeeping shortcuts (e.g., token quotas, post-hoc penalties) and validates that no illegal moves occur
Ensures the final ordered move list is minimal with respect to the chosen objective and adheres to agent restrictions
auditor.goal: Audit the candidate move sequence for legality and consistency and publish the final ordered list of primitive moves.

private_information: Coordinates agents and compiles the final PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownward solver
Integrates audited plan and environment specification
orchestrator.goal: Produce a correct PDDL domain and problem for the specified 3-peg, 15-disk multi-agent Tower of Hanoi instance so that a planner like FastDownward can validate or search for plans satisfying the goal.

public_information: Puzzle: 3-peg Tower of Hanoi with 15 disks labeled A (smallest) through O (largest).
Agent partitioning: agent_1 moves {A,B,C,D,E}; agent_2 moves {F,G,H,I,J}; agent_3 moves {K,L,M,N,O}.
Rule: Only one disk may be moved at a time; no disk may be placed on top of a smaller disk.
Initial configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg empty.
Goal configuration: left peg has (top→bottom) B, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K, L, M, N, O; middle peg empty; right peg has (top→bottom) A, C.

propose_moves.system_prompt: You are agent_1 and may move only disks A–E. Respect Tower of Hanoi rules and propose a concise sequence achieving the goal while avoiding unnecessary moves of larger disks.
propose_moves.prompt: Provide a candidate ordered list of primitive moves limited to disks A–C that achieves the target configuration, expressed as 'agent_1: move disk X from peg1 to peg2'.

propose_safety.system_prompt: You are agent_2 and may move only disks F–J. Your role is to assert constraints that prevent movement of these disks unless strictly needed.
propose_safety.prompt: Confirm that disks F–J remain unmoved for this instance and state any necessary constraints to guarantee that.

propose_safety.system_prompt: You are agent_3 and may move only disks K–O. Your role is to assert constraints that keep these disks fixed on the left peg.
propose_safety.prompt: Confirm that disks K–O remain unmoved for this instance and state any necessary constraints to guarantee that.

audit_plan.system_prompt: You audit temporal and causal consistency of multi-agent plans. You verify legality with respect to Tower of Hanoi rules and agent partitioning, remove bookkeeping shortcuts, and publish the final move list.
audit_plan.prompt: Check the candidate moves for correctness with respect to the rules and constraints, then output the final ordered list of primitive moves achieving the goal.

ordered_moves: agent_1: move disk A from left to right
agent_1: move disk B from left to middle
agent_1: move disk A from right to middle
agent_1: move disk C from left to right
agent_1: move disk A from middle to right
agent_1: move disk B from middle to left
result.notes: This 6-step sequence moves A and C to the right peg with A on top of C, restores B to the top of the left peg, leaves middle peg empty, and never moves disks D–O. All agent restrictions and Tower of Hanoi rules are respected.

fd_pddl.system_prompt: Produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownward. Keep multi-agent constraints via an 'allowed' predicate by agent and disk. Enclose outputs in <domain></domain> and <problem></problem> tags.
fd_pddl.prompt: Compile the 3-peg, 15-disk Tower of Hanoi with agent partitioning into a typed STRIPS PDDL domain and a specific problem matching the initial and goal configurations. The problem should be solvable by FastDownward without additional assumptions. Use lowercase identifiers for PDDL symbols.

orchestrator.pddl_orchestrator: <domain>(define (domain hanoi_multiagent_15) (:requirements :strips :typing) (:types support disk peg - support agent) (:predicates (on ?x - disk ?y - support) (clear ?s - support) (smaller ?x - disk ?y - disk) (allowed ?a - agent ?x - disk)) (:action move_to_peg :parameters (?a - agent ?x - disk ?from - support ?p - peg) :precondition (and (clear ?x) (clear ?p) (on ?x ?from) (allowed ?a ?x)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?p) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?p)))) (:action move_to_disk :parameters (?a - agent ?x - disk ?from - support ?y - disk) :precondition (and (clear ?x) (clear ?y) (on ?x ?from) (smaller ?x ?y) (allowed ?a ?x)) :effect (and (not (on ?x ?from)) (on ?x ?y) (clear ?from) (not (clear ?y)))))</domain> <problem>(define (problem
